Since they opened the quality I feel as gone down, especially for my favorite garlic knot sliders.  The garlic and salt taste is no longer as strong as they once were on the knots.  They also have lunch specials that end at 3pm(?) but they're flexible and will still give you the deal.

I am a fan of NYC thin-crust pizza.  And yes, I've actually had it in NYC.  Sabatino's tries but their pizza just comes out OK.  No real complaints, but it just doesn't come up as something I'd go out of my way for.  

This is kind of sad, because I literally live 5 minutes away from the place.  When I have the craving for NY style pizza?  My thoughts automatically wander to someplace across town like Broadway Pizza (sorry guys).  That place makes an excellent pie.

Pizza at Sabatino's looks pretty good and for the most part comes out fresh.  But the crust for me just isn't as tasty as I'd want it to be.  I dunno, maybe it's just me and maybe my taste buds are just out of whack.  Either way, I just don't see myself coming here that often for a slice of the pie.

Sabatino's does have some decent specials, $5.99 for two slices of cheese pizza and a drink.  They also have a pizza buffet going on for $7.99 I believe that comes with:

-Cheese pizza
-Salad
-Pasta with marinara
-Garlic knots
-Drink

We had this buffet to give the place a go but was a bit underimpressed.  I mean, if you're going to offer a buffet, why only cheese pizza?  My guess is to keep the costs down.  I don't mind cheese pizza (when it's good and cheesy), but Sabatino's was light on the cheese.  The salad was basic bag salad with some tomatoes and red onion added.  The pasta was just penne with marinara sauce.  Their sauce wasn't anything special, I hate saying it but it's possible it wasn't made in-house.  The garlic knots?  I've had better.  Wasn't worth the money per person for their buffet.  I rather have stuck with $5 per person at the local Cici's pizza.  There you know you're not getting 'authentic' NY style pizza, but you get more choices.  

Service was ok, a bit slow but very friendly.  It's possible we had a newer server helping us out.  Restaurant just wasn't that busy on a weekend, it's kind of a sign that folks might think Sabatino's is run-of-the-mill.  

Like the look of the place with all the NY memorabilia plastered on their walls.  Just need some improvement on the NY eats.

When I came here I didn't know what to expect. But I heard that New York style pizza is really good and made for on-the-go.  

Nevertheless, once I tried Sabatino's, I was more than satisfied. The pizza is here is good and they give you really big slices.

My family and I have been ordering from this restaurant for a few years. Most of the time it's good but lately food and service has been deteriorating. We ordered a pizza and a sandwich. The food was delivered. When we opened the pizza it was cold.  We called to complain about the cold pizza. We were told that it couldn't possibly be cold and basically we were lying. The person who answered the phone would not give his name and was extremely rude. I will no longer order from there. Rosati's will now get all my business.

Old style Italian food.....fresh salad ....pizza habit forming. Mon. Nite pizza special ...can't be beat....everyone I brought to s a b a t I n o s..comes back for more.  My entire family..my friends love this place...just came back  from dinner..Sat outside with family and 2 young children..service was excellent..Kids had fun and we all enjoyed the dinner.  W o o h o o !

Once we got the right pizza it was wonderful.  The driver delivered us the wrong pizza we ordered a Brooklyn and got a pepperoni.  Called the the store and they rectified it immediately.  YUMMY YUMMY.  We will definitely order from them again.

My family comes here at least every couple of weeks.  We feel they have pretty good food for pretty good prices. 

They offer 2 slice specials for lunch and honor them in the evening as well. 

The staff is pleasant every time and the only knock I have is the radio, although playing good music is always cranked up too loud - like uncomfortably loud.  Once we asked them to turn it down so we could carry on in conversation and they quickly obliged.  However, we are kinda embarrassed to ask so hope they get the hint.

Overall, we like this place and its in the family rotation
Go here a lot good service and value for the money. Food is consistent. Will continue to to come back.

Once again looking at places near our Vegas home we came across Sabatino's, we really had no idea what to expect.  The place was packed and many take out orders were going and yet we were greeted warmly and quickly and were told to sit wherever we liked.  Our server brought us menus and took our drink order.  Fast and with a smile.  

We made our choices and as usual, with my family, substitutions and additions were asked for (thats what you get when cooks go out).  All our requests were honored.  

All of our food was wonderful and the service was even better.  So happy to know that this place is in the neighborhood and BONUS they deliver!!!  OH YES.

We just tried Sabatino's and were okay with everything.  

First off, the food arrived super fast!  We got it almost 15 minutes earlier than the quoted time. We tried pizza, chicken, and pasta and everything was hot.  This is always good with us because we are always down to eat!

The food itself was ok.  Nothing special, but not bad either.  The pizza was a thin crust style and a little on the greasy side.  The baked ziti was ok, but again nothing special.  The chicken fingers were pretty good, but tasted like most bar chicken fingers.  Again nothing special.  Everything tasted ok and will do if you are in a pinch, but there are plenty of other places in town with great food that I would rather visit first.

I also think the prices at Sabatino's are high for what you actually get.  Our meal was $45 and I think it should have been about $27-35 max.  I have no problem paying to great food, but this place is too high, in my opinion.

Yeah, so everything is ok, but not special.

So Sabatino's has redeemd themselves in my eyes.  In stark contrast to the sandwich I had on my first visit to this establishment, the stromboli I had on the second was a winner.  I was about to order a build-your-own three topping 'boli when I saw the menu ready eggplant, roasted red pepper and smoked mozzarella calzone/stromboli.  That sounded great so that is what I went with.  I also ordered Abita Amber beer on draught.  As I sipped my beer and watched whatever sports news show was on TV while waiting eagerly for my 'boli I was brought a bascket of garlic knotts.  These twisty little nubbins of dough were hot and fresh.  Not to mention delicious with their garlic topping and fresh marinara asuce for dipping.  These knotts alone were worth the second visit to a place I originally did not put much stock in.  And then came the stromboli looking all wicked good.  It was stuffed with cheese, pieces of red pepper and some strange looking but awesome tasting eggplant.  The eggplant looked batter fried rather than breaded.  Regardless,  it was good eats.  I ate two of the three large pieces of the stromboli and took the other home.  Can you say breakfast?  I'm a fan now as even as leftovers this stromboli was fantastic.  Plus the staff was great last night. The man serving the dining room has made a good impression.

So disappointed. Been our go to for authentic NY pizza and meatball sandwich for a long time (fiancé is from NY so is a must that we order the best) but since we just learned about new owners when we called in our order we questioned the guy on the phone about changes to the food. He assured us it's the same.  
No. No it's not. They get 2 stars because the positive is that I didn't have to cook and they delivered. 
Meatball parm was not toasted and pretty dry (no sauce). Meatballs were different and delivered in styrofoam. Prior to ownership change the sandwich had good amt of sauce, toasted and wrapped in the paper lined foil. 
I always have a small pie with olive oil instead of red sauce, pepperoni, black olives and extra cheese. The crust is normally thin, as authentic NY should be. 
Not anymore. It was thick, like frozen crust, can't be sure there was olive oil, cheese is not the same quality as before and let's not forget that it was cold. 
They used to be so much better than Rocco's but now they both are terrible and there is no good place to get authentic NY pizza that we're aware of. Apparently it was one of the cooks that bought the place. He's clearly gone cheap.  Sorry Sabatino's....we were regulars. We won't be back.
Everything is always fantastic and delicious.   They go above and beyond with special requests even if it means chopping up tomatoes!  Love this place

This place has changed.  I used to love their food, but for the last couple of months the service is terrible, and they have got all of our orders wrong.  They always blame the customer for the their mistakes.  The manager is low IQ, clueless, and unwilling to resolve any issues.
Such good pizza and service! Ryan might be the greatest server ever. The sauce is the best and the wings are amazing

As the previous reviews have noted, customer service is hit or miss and the location needs logistical kinks to work out. 

The order process: by phone it is easy as pie, in person it's the same. By Yelp's eat24 feature,... Not so great. This place is popular and typically the eat24 orders go last in line. 

The ambience: I've only gone on weekends and can say most employees are trying to deal with the rush as best they can but it can seem a bit chaotic. Pizza boxes stacked high, a thing NYC joints do to prepare for rushes; here it looks like decor (I hope I'm wrong). Also lots of photos of snowstorms back in NYC... Why be nostalgic about that I'm not sure of.

The wait: back in NYC waiting 30 min is ideal, but 50-60 minutes is the norm. In the suburbs of a suburban city, 60 minutes is outrageous, however it seems to be the norm here. Even when I ordered by phone and stopped by after the prescribed 15 minutes I still waited about 10 more. When ordering online it took literally an hour... Oy vey..

And now, the pizza: 
Cheese, excellent. Sauce, herb-y perfection. Crust: thicker than old-school city slices but crispy. All together it reminds me of today's slices back in NY. 

Overall I'll order again but on slow days and early!

I tend to get pizza from here pretty regularly but the last few times it wasn't that good. The pizza has been getting smaller with each order. We usually get a large for pick up and the last few times the large has been looking more like a medium. It's a shame because the pizza is pretty good. If it wasn't for the inconsistency, this place defiantly deserves more starts. 
Oh, their garlic knots and provolone pepperoni Stromboli are pretty good.

Great place. Pizza is really good and so are the canolis. The delivery driver, Bryan, went out of his way to deliver to my house which is out of their delivery radius.  Even with the extra distance he made it here in a timely fashion and was extremely pleasant.  I would definitely recommend this place.

I am from New York and if anyone from New York can tell me this is NY pizza, you're NOT from New York.. I'm so sorry to say this place is awful, the people are wonderful but I wasn't going here for a social party, I was going to dinner. OMG AWFUL, is all I could think of. Don't take my word for it, just go and you'll see just what I mean. People were ordering ate one thing and asked for a box, maybe they didn't want to hurt the girls feelings.
I was so excited to have a place so close to me, but I guess I am still going to have to travel to Metro for a decent piece of pizza.
Sorry Sabatino, your place is nothing like anyplace in NEW YORK!!!!!!!

...since they didn't have their beer license yet, I decided on a take-out order of spaghetti with meatballs. I wasn't disappointed with either quality or quantity. and neither was my wife. The sauce was second to none and the staff was attentive. I'll try their pizza the next time.

Very diverse menu! The service is dependent on how many customers and servers there are, but overall the staff are very good. The portions are very large, 1 slice of cheese pizza is HUGE! It is NY style so it is very thin and even an expert pizza handler may need to fold it. The quality is decent for the low costs of their various food options. This location has removed some items from their menu due to conflicts with other restaurants in the strip mall area. But, they have enough alternative items to satisfy your stomach. Probably will eat here again in the future.
The food was great! The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because they forgot our salads. I love their ranch, pizza and wings were awesome!
I'm not sure if the "all you can eat pizza is good" however, if you order you own large/medium pizza I believe you wont be disappointing. I would definitely recommend the place.
Great New York Style Pizza with lots of flavor. Huge pizza slices but they were about to cut slices in halves. Also great friendly staff, felt welcomed and comfortable. Great family environment.
Best pizza ever. Super big slices. Cheese melts in your mouth  I have came to this place many times. It's awesome
pizza, wings, antipasta salad, garlic knots.............absolutely OUTSTANDING!!!!!!!  ty so very much! my favorite!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I was so happy to see this place open after Aurelio's closed! The staff was warm and welcoming and treated us like family. They brought out garlic knots for us to try and they were amazing! Pizza is very good. Also had it delivered the second time and wait time was 45 minutes (normal for pizza on a Friday night) and arrived hot and fresh. We've brought 6 other people here and will continue to recommend.

We ordered a pizza for a delivery at 4:15 thru GrubHub. According to the confirmation, the pizza would arrive an hour to hour fifteen minutes later. After waiting that hour and 15 minutes, we called to see where the pizza was. They said that they did not receive the order from GrubHub until 20 minutes prior. When we offer to send them the confirmation that GrubHub said they received our order an hour and 15 minutes prior,  they declined. Instead of trying to fix the problem by rushing our order to the top, they told us it would be another hour and 15 minutes.  Then upon asking for a refund, we were put on hold for another 10 minutes and then told that they couldn't process the refund right away. Not very good customer service at all!
Pizza is New York delicious as well as great priced. Took my family there and large cheese pizza is $13.99! Can't leave out the wonderful array of desserts that they have. Gotta try the tiramisu.

Ordered pizza(personal) 6 wings, basket of fries.  We were in a rush to pick it up, paid $45.00.   All of us got sick!!Then when we went a few days Later to complain about price and quality, we were told a manager would call.  Weeks later and NO call.  Not great customer service!. They just lost a good regular customer!  Now congrats to Rosati's we are regular weekly customers!

Have only had the pizza which is very good for west coast. (Outside of NY) 
Sabatinos and Villa pizza are my 2 favs
In LV.  Not always consistent though. I guess it depends on who made it on any particular day. But it is always good and sometimes exceptional. Prices are about average. If you want cheap pizza go to little Caesars. But you get what you pay for. 



They're slipping. I can no longer give a solid recommendation for this restaurant. 
The quality comes and goes. There are good nights and bad nights. Hopefully you will catch them on one of their good nights.
Delivery took all of 45 mins. Not bad, not great. The Hawaiian Pizza has bacon on it...very yummy. But no olives available for my pepperoni?

The cheese pizza with fried eggplant and onion was good but nothing special. Other reviews raved about to die for sauce but I was not impressed with the sauce or crust. There is much better pizza in Vegas. I would not go out of my way for this pizza. The reviews are overrated.
Great food and great service. We got the Stromboli, wings and pizza. Our son loved everything too. Very clean and updated look. New York themed everything.

This place is killer!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Got cheese pizza......amazing. Sicilian meat lovers......amazing. Alex was so friendly and welcomed us to the area. I'm hoping the pizzas are always this good cause I'll be ordering from here like crazy!!!! Must try!!!!!!!
Delicious pizza and garlic knots. The "all you can eat" option is awesome too. You'll be stuffed with just one round of the salad, pasta and pizza slice.

It took 1 1/2 hours to get an online order delivered. It was New Years Eve, granted, but ordered very early in the evening. The food was cold and had to be reheated. We normally pick up and have had no issues, but tonight we tried delivery and won't do that again. Pick up has always been fine.

Tough night in the kitchen at Sabatino's tonight.
We order a 2 slice special, cant go wrong, always delicious.  But we also tried an Entree. Yikes?
The slices came out in 10 minutes,  a long time as we were the only 2  in the dining room. 10 minutes later the entree came out and it was cold. Not just not hot, but refrigerated cold. Back it went. Out it came. This time the bread was chilled. The very nice server offer to replace with garlic knots. You guessed it, not hot. The poor server was cringing.

We also order some to go food. The order was incorrect and took 30 minutes. Chicken Parm, wings, and a med pizza.

And the check was wrong. Tough night. My suggestion is go for the pizza. If you own the place, hire better kitchen people. They are hurting your brand. Good service in the front of the house.

My husband and I order from them usually once a week or at least once every other week! They have the best white pizza in the city! This is definitely our favorite pizza place! They have great garlic knots as well. I recommend them to everyone!
Best pizza in town! The girls here are so awesome and super friendly! It's a hometown feel with amazing food! White pizza add garlic is the bomb!!!

Ordered delivery on a Wednesday later, we were given an estimate of 60 minutes. 60 minutes being the maximum, surely it shouldn't take that long. An hour later, by 8:50, still nothing. Called the restaurant, they said they didn't see the order w the name so it is on the way... Even though it really should be here already. Food finally got here another 25 minutes later, at 9:15pm. The delivery guy didn't even apologize, just said today of all days was very busy. Should not have taken 1 hrs and 25 minutes to cook and deliver one pizza, one cannoli, and one bottle of soda. 

The pizza itself was not bad at all; it was actually very delicious. But we will not be ordering from them again, unless we are not hungry at all and we have a lot of time to kill.

As my sister nephew and I walk in we sit ourselves as the sign says to do so. There are 6 other tables being served. We waited a good 10 minutes before even being acknowledged. Finally an older gentleman came to us and asked if we've been helped. We ordered our drinks first and waited another 10 minutes to order our meal. We simply asked for garlic knots and a small house salad to start off with followed by a large half cheese half pepperoni and sausage pizza. A lady brought my sister her salad with a small to-go size cup of ranch with no utensils. We waited another 6. Finally after getting someone's attention we asked for utensils and napkins. She brings us 2 forks and 2 napkins, remind you there are 3 of us. My sister begins to eat...the ranch only covered a little of the top part. We're trying to get 1 of 8 people we saw working there, (one guy in a green hat was behind the counter on his phone,) to let them know we needed more ranch and an extra plate because the lady only brought 2. Irritated and fed up I tell the her our pizza is to go and we got up to leave. I checked the pizza and of course it was only cheese and pepperoni. No sausage. I made sure they didn't charge us for it. Worst customer service I've ever had and I've had lunch here many times and have never been treated like this. I'll take my service somewhere else.

My rating is relative to all the other pizza places that have delivered to me, since I've lived in Vegas. New Yorkers would probably rate it 3 or 4 stars. 
Far and away the best delivery pizza (in my neighborhood). The best thing to get is the 22" pizza, because the crust turns out to be the thinnest with that one. 
The wings are pretty good as well, and reasonably priced relative to other places that deliver wings.
Sometimes they forget my blue cheese dressing for my wings, but other than that, I really have no complaints with this place.
Oh, and I tried the calzone once, and it was also above average.
Had the food delivered, 2 stars for promptness, but yuck on the food!

Aaahhhh quick recap - 

Pizza - not as good as I remember. Maybe it was too much sauce? Maybe it was the taste of the sauce? Maybe it wasn't hot enough? Maybe it was me? 
It just didn't cut it for me. I've been too spoiled by another great place down the street from me. No one can touch it yet in town. 

BUT...dem garlic knots. Simply delightful. Those knots are best bestest knots I've had in a long time. They're so soft, fluffy, thick, buttery, full of garlic and herbs...it's better than ice cold water on a hot summer day. I'm tellin' ya. They are devine.

I am a connoisseur of pizza both New York style and Chicago style. Sabatino's sent a cold, flavorless sauce and an overly chewy crust to us. I was not impressed. Their Greek salad on the other hand had fresh lettuce, tomatoes, plenty of kalamata olives and red onions and feta. Balsamic was flavorful but nothing spectacular. 

The fiancé had the turkey club sandwich with wilted lettuce and old gritty darkened tomato and cheese that was dried out on the edges and stale bread. It was a terrible debacle of bad ingredients and poor design. Sandwiches aren't that hard. Start with fresh ingredients and the rest follows along. 

Sabatino's will not be going into my speed dial for delivery. I'd give the salad a 4, pizza a 2 1/2 and the sandwich a 1.
Called in a delivery order. Lady was super friendly. Got pizza, garlic knots and Italian salad with house dressing. Everything was delicious. Would order from them again for sure.

Easy 5 star...here's why :

The pizza is awesome.  These are huge NY style slices...definitely need to be folded.  Crust is thin and yummy...toppings and sauce are good.

I am a HUGE pizza fan, of all shapes and sizes, and my entire life I've been a pepperoni lover...fan...connoisseur.  But after a visit from Sabatino's, my life has changed LOL.

You gotta do their sausage topping.  It is amazing!  It is slightly sweet, full of spices and flavor.  This blew away their pep topping, and made the slices.  OMG great!  See if you agree!

The other reason why this place is an easy 5 star spot....the prices are stupid cheap.

I felt like I was robbing this place.  $7.99 for an AYCE cheese pizza, garlic knots, pasta, and salad?  And no, this isn't some ghetto or nasty buffet style food spot (don't let the "food showcase" scare you away...they don't serve that food to us!).  It is an extra $1 to get toppings, and an extra $2 for any way you want em.  So for $9 we got all this food!  And yes, the AYCE is all day.

Since you already know how good the pizza is, I will fill in the rest.  The knots are pretty good, not mind blowing, but good.  The pasta is ok...but I won't bother with them again.....I have become jaded with excellent pasta from Italian spots in town.  The salads I didn't touch..but the company said they were ok.

They also have 2 slices + drink for $5.99 or something like that.  These slices are like 4 regular pizza place slices.  

Service is also pretty good.  The server was friendly and refilled and requested often enough.

Yes, it is worth the drive.  Give it a shot!
We had pizza, penne al a vodka and cannolis. Everything was delicious!! We can't wait to return!!

We just ordered chicken parmigiana sandwich, veggie pizza and the cannoli sliders. The food was pretty good, the sandwich was awesome. I don't know what they did to it but it was seasoned perfect! The marinara sauce is really good too, especially if you like garlic. The cannoli sliders are huge! Honestly, 4 people could share one. The order came on time but that suggestion someone said to call or just do pick up instead of the app was solid advice. I only knocked off a star because they don't use diced tomatoes, just whole slices and I think it made the pizza a little soggy.  Otherwise, great, I'd totally order from them again
I've only ordered delivery from here. The food was okay,  not great,  but not bad. The delivery person was competent. No problems,  but nothing that stood out.

Tried the pizza twice. First time for an early start to new years eve. So bad we could not eat it. Crust was worse than one of those grocery store pre-mades. Crunchy without even being browned. Sauce was burned and over garlicy. Got our money back. Six months later we built up the nerve to try it again. Not so bad that I would feel justified demanding my money back but it was nowhere near up to the challenge of other neighborhood pies. Stick to the pastas that are not bad and AVOID the pizza. AVOID THE PIZZA!!!!!

The aroma of Sabatino's cheese, dough, and oil is very comforting. My endorphins begin to rush while I await that first bite. The substantial portions are enough to feed one whole family for a few days, which the price remains adequate enough to keep me coming back. Their delicious NY Style Pizza is authentic and fabulous.

Absolutely horrible. Took 18 minutes for 2 slices of pizza, and not one person came to tell me it's going to be a while. I had an appointment and took it to go. Then, both slices fell apart as soon as I put it in the box. There's more grease in my box then in my coconut oil jar at home. On top of that, the pizza was mediocre, at best. Thought I would come in and get a quick bite and... NOPE! Time guzzler here. Don't waste your money, especially time here!

I love thin-crust NY-style pizza. Sabatino's is close to work so I get to go here/ have food delivered whenever I have a craving for a pie. I like their Fresca pizza (fresh basil, tomatoes and mozzarella cheese) and Everything pizza (sausage, pepperoni, ham, meatball, mushrooms, onions, tomatoes and green bell peppers).  The sausage is terrific and the crust is crisp and not bland. They have huge pizzas: 14", 16", 21" and bigger than that is a Sicilian. They have good eggplant parm and garlic knots. 

My favorites are their ham, salami, pepperoni and provolone Stromboli and the powdered sugar zeppoles...sooooo gooood!!! I can't stop eating them.

I've been here a few times now so I figured I now enough about the place to review it.

Very clean and spacious. The atmosphere is bright and happy and has plenty of reminders of some of what NYC is about. I particularly love the black and white pictures of the city, old and new. One of the things I love about them the most is that they have pictures of other NYC boroughs other than Manhattan. Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn, and they may even have Staten Island. It's a very comfortable and colorful restaurant that invites you in and invites you to stay a while. The restrooms are kept very clean and stocked.

The service is adequate. Friendly, efficient, nothing to rave about but it works. Its what is should be and nothing more. 

The food is what gives this place 4 stars instead of 5. It's just OK, but for the price, it's good. You can get your usual two-slice deal here for about $6 which isn't bad if you're looking for a quick substantial meal for a good price. They tend to get a bit inconsistent with their pizza slices. Sometimes it's E 116th Street perfect, and sometimes not so much. The last time I eat there I couldn't fold my slice in half without it falling apart with is not a good thing. Other times the crust is perfectly thin and sturdy. The sauce to cheese ratio is excellent. It may be because they have different chefs but for the most part it's pretty good.

Only gave 1 star because 0 wasn't an option. I Ordered 50 bucks worth of pizza, wings (the smallest I have ever seen), and garlic knots. Waited almost an hour for them to deliver it.  Paid the $3 delivery charge and tipped the driver, just for me to not get the pizza. I called and had to wait an additional 45 min for a pizza they said they remade. It was cold in the center, and the crust was cold too, and the meatballs were nothing more than crumbled ground beef. Remade my ass. So the moral of the story is if you feel like eating cold food and wasting 50 bucks you should totally order from Sabatino's.

Back in October 2013, my Dad was in & out of the hospital nearby a couple of times. When he got checked in there late, he was really hungry and I suggested a pizza. Sabatino's was just about to close but took our order and delivered it fast too. I can't remember what we ordered now, but he hadn't been able to have pizza in a while, but said it was the best tasting one he's had in a very long time. He was a pilot and had flown around the world many times, so that's some high praise. I've been a pizzeria manager too. Their quality is second to none, and their service is excellent. My pops lived around the corner from them and we'd been in a few times before as well. Don't think about it, just call in your order or head in for a nice clean table, smiling employees, and awesome pizza.

Meh...I pass this place at least once a week and have been curious. I called in my order for pick up, they were nice. My order was ready when promised. Staff inside were pleasant. The pizza price was comparable. $17.29 for a large with extra cheese and half sausage. The pizza looked okay but it wasn't any thing special. I've had better in Vegas. The sausage was good but the plain cheese was kind of bland. The crust doesn't have that crunch with the chewy, airy bite that you're looking for in good crust. It was more a crackery crisp.
I doubt I'll ever go back, it isn't worth it.

Just got a pizza delivered from here and we were all extremely happy. They said 45 minutes...arrived in 30. Nice speedy delivery. the delivery guy was super nice. Brought it in the house for us. The pizza is out of this world delicious. We ordered the "brooklyn".....double sausage..double cheese and double pepperoni! NY style...8 LARGE slices. Fresh ingredients and really good. The three of us had trouble finishing. a home run!

I'm quite torn on dishing out stars for this place.  Soooo, if you dine in they have a fantastic special  - for $7.99 you get ayce salad, garlic knots, pasta, & pizza.  They have 2 different guys that work here that are awesome servers, otherwise the rest of the staff is confused and annoying.  There is a female server who is 100% confused and down right annoying because she consistently got every order wrong that we tried to give her, forgot to put the order in, and frequently  interrupted our conversation to clarify her misunderstandings.  On top of that she talked really loud, almost as if she was yelling at us.

I tried to order delivery pizza and the guy on the phone couldn't figure out how to a) give me a the proper link to the menu or b) email a copy of the menu to me.  He then decided the best route was to have the delivery guy bring a copy to me, which ultimately took forever as he recorded the address wrong.  I was informed that the person I spoke with on the phone was the manager.  When I finally got to place a pizza order an hour later, I requested and paid extra for prosciutto.  When the pizza arrived it was adorned with common ham.

I wanna give this place more love, but if I can't dine in and sit in one of the 2 good servers' sections, then I would rather eat somewhere else.

Well... First let me start by saying NOT impressed. I was quoted 45-60 min, 90 min later I get my food. By that point the pizza was freezing cold. I'll eat it cause I'm starving but won't be back. 

Also I read all the reviews on the garlic knots and I am rather shocked. These knots were so hard, there goes 5 bucks down the drain, that I couldn't even chew them. 

I forgot to mention, I got a medium pepperoni and 6 garlic knots. With tax,tip and delivery charge.... 27.38. Bit much for hard dough, cold medium pizza that was late.


*******I have since updated my rating... The owner has contacted me to make this right. We haven't come to a resolution yet but the fact that he had gone out of his way to talk to me and try to make this right, SPEAKS VOLUMES. I haven't done many reviews since I opened this new account but have actually been a member(on another account) since 2011 and he was the FIRST to contact me and make this right. Kudos on customer service!

had to return for more garlic knots. Bryan my server talked me into them with subtle suggestions. I don't usually go for that but stopped randomly a few nights ago starving.

I had to return for the garlic knots after having tried them for the first time earlier this week.  Would definitely recommend to friends.

We ordered the Fresca pizza and the Brooklyn pizza with garlic knots and cinnamon sugar Zeppoles. The best pizza we've had! Prompt delivery service and very tasty! Definitely coming back and highly recommended!
Trying this out for the first time. Just ordered the Fresca and the Hawaiian. Love the ambiance here!

Hands down the closest thing to pizza from NYC. I lived there for 5 years and the pizza is just as big, crust is similar and so is the cheesecake.  The staff is very friendly, the decor is all NY sports (and Giants are my fav). Good prices, pretty cheap, and their garlic knots that are filled are pretty awesome as well as their marinara sauce. Will def go back.

Very hard to get info over the phone had to call 2 times just to see if it was by the slice. Took 25 min to get a slice and a garlic roll. On a Saturday afternoon was a bit busy but everyone has already ordered. Decent environment good price, so the pizza wasn't cooked completely the crust was doughy under the sauce. Real greasy to be expected though. Had the garlic slider couldn't finish it took it to go. Ended up pretty good. Red head behind the counter is gorgeous haha but doesn't ever smile. Service was decent food decent clean store. Never go on lunch break. Will I be back ehhh maybe.

We ordered a hot pastrami sandwich and a cold Italian and we waited inside for 40 minutes. The hot pastrami was cold and the  bread was burnt!

Should have been a red flag when the guy at the cash register couldn't even tell me what came on either sandwich. 

Note to self, just go to subway next door for sandwiches!

Favorite place to go to for pizza. My #1! I always come here with my boyfriend and we love it. Pepperoni pizza & barbecue chicken pizza are our go-to's. 
Jeff is always there when we go, and he's the nicest server there is!

Ordered online and got a confirmation that the order was received. The text stated they needed more time they were busy food would be ready @ 7:42. I get there and they did not prepare the order. Do not use EAT24 and avoid this place. Poor service and this seems to be a reoccurring complaint. 

Not a satisfied customer.

This place is a classic example of identity crisis. They would do fine just sticking to pizza but a while back they had veal parmigian on the menu and It was recommended to me by the waitress, she said all the pastas were amazing. It was terrible to say the least, an obvious microwave meal. It was floating in some watered down sauce I told my waitress immediately and they did nothing about it. I still had to pay for it too, no one gets a pass with these guys. There's to many places to choose from to waste your time here.

These people are ridiculous... 

I called in and some female answers the phone and says "can I put your on a BRIEF hold?" sure.. no problem, maybe they are busy, I've never called before, and never been there before, first time POSSIBLE customer... 

so this girl didn't even put me on hold, she just sat the phone on the counter and continued her 5-7 minute conversation with another female employee... then  some other customers came and walked in, I heard them get greeted, and then I heard someone pick up the phone (that I am waiting on to speak with someone to put in an order) and the phone gets hung up on... I literally waited for 5-7 minutes... then some guests walked in, and this girl didn't even check to see if someone was on the phone... she just hangs it up... like really??? did you not hear me yelling HELLO???? do you just normally pick up a phone, and hang it up? did you forget that 5-7 minutes ago you answered a phone call and "placed me on hold" so you could finish your STUPID CONVO with your coworker about NOTHING... welp... sorry, but I just wanted to tell your manager how sad the employees are ruining this business... and let it known that unfortunately their food probably tastes amazing, but I'm not going to be ordering it to find out.  HOW CAN YOU NOT PICK UP THE PHONE THAT YOU PLACED ON HOLD?! what makes someone think their co worker's conversation is more important than taking an order over the phone... like really? you should be fired. if you're that incompetent, you should just go work at walmart, they are equal opportunity employers.

I must admit that I was a little skeptical when reading some of the reviews. I have to say the food was awesome. My friend wanted pizza and I didn't feel like going out. I ordered the Brooklyn. Great choice!! I also got some wings and the zeppoles. Thats  like powdered sugared doughnuts. The wings were good. Let me tell you, I'm not easily impressed but this food was good. The pizza was great. The wings were good. And the zeppoles were awesome. I literally ate them until I couldn't eat anymore. I will be ordering from this place again!!!
I've ordered from Sabatino's multiple times, and I've never been disappointed.  Lots of choices, decent portions and you have GOT to try the Cannoli Sliders!  So wrong, but so right!

I have never gone to social media to complain, however this is the first time I've had to resort to this. Hopefully the OWNER of this business sees this... This is not a friendly place I would ever eat nor give business to.  After my aunt ordered over $50 of food and getting home to realize they forgot one of her orders, she called the cashier who advised she didn't pay for it when we had the receipt in hand. She advised of this at which time she was notified she would receive a call back. After 10 min of waiting we called back and the rude gentleman said he was waiting for her to call back.... Why would she call back when she's the one waiting for you to resolve the issue??!! Anyhow, we finally determine that they would deliver the missing order which is less than a mile away. The food was then delivered in a bag with "HJH" on it.  My aunt brought me the bag and asked what it was.... well with one click of the internet, HJH apparently stands for "Hand Job Honey".  Needless to say I was furious!!! I called back and asked to speak to the "manager". Let me tell you, I have never dealt with a more unprofessional person. I asked him what it meant and he advised it was just letters they put for her order. I again asked him what it meant and he said it was just random letters.... SERIOUSLY???!!! What a "random" coincidence right? I then asked to speak to the person he reports to which is the owner, however the owner won't be visiting his store for at least two weeks.... WOW! I wonder if he is aware of how his business is being run. At this point, I can only imagine what they did to my aunts food. I'm almost tempted to take it to have it tested for any bodily fluids since I didn't let her eat it.  I'm wondering if anyone else has had issues with the employees of this place? Specifically Jeff or Greg. Don't be surprised if this hits the news!

BEWARE!!! I will never go back here again! I have ordered from my home and business to ensure this place was successful. Now I save up the 10 coupons for the free pizza and then, and only then do they inform me that there's a $12 minimum delivery charge?! Never again will you scam me. Trust me, I deal with people all day long. Your business will suffer for this garbage. Guarantee that! Why is the staff not being told of these procedures, my guess is the owners logic is that it's easier to give the staff minimal training. What he fails to see is all these bad reviews because of poor management of his business. Not sorry to see your demise.

Im not sure how Im going to rate this place yet. The pizza is a thin crust NY style pizza sauce was kind of weak, no unique or outstanding flavor (good or bad) price wasnt bad but for the price you do get a whole lot of food.

We ordered the monster and at other restaurants they normally fill the pie up so you much you cant see nothing else. Here the toppings barely filled up the 2nd largest pie they make.

The grease on the pizza wasnt overly excessive but I did have to ask for extra napkins to soak it up on the two slices I consumed. This was telling me they were using low quality toppings.

The garlic knots were very tasty and the tomato sauce they served with them was bland as well but you could taste the tomato so congratulations I guess?

The wait staff was very patient with this being our first time and their menu being a cluttered mess of Italian food Im sure they are used to a million questions before a party is ready to order. I spent a few minutes trying to determine if this was a pizzeria or an Italian pasta restaurant? 

The wait staff kept or drinks full and checked on us throughout our meal without being obnoxious about it. (I did have to explain what Canadian Bacon was though and that just seemed like something they should automatically know)

The Angel Hair Pasta wasn't real Angel Hair(full size pasta isn't Angel hair) and the sauce was similar to the pizza and was so weak my GF asked for Tabasco to add flavor to it.

The decor is cool sports memorabilia and I was able to glance at a football game from my seat so it seemed like a cool place to grab a slice (they sell it by the slice) and watch a few mins of a game. The TVs arent at the best angles for all the seats so make sure you get their early to ensure you are able to get a good view of the game.

Its not a bad place to eat but I cant give it top marks and three stars is slightly too many.
This place is awesome . Pizza, chicken wings and fries . So delicious . I will definitely be back.  Normal wait time. Worth the wait.
I'm from NJ and quite a pizza snob and since moving to Vegas we have tried MANY places claiming to be "NYC pizza"... AT LAST we have found a winner!!

First meal in vegas and glad i did its ten times better then any az pizzeria that we have wild white pizza and teriyaki wings.. First the pizza sooo good white sauce almost tasted like a claim sauce but not but amazing !!!! Normally in az we get half azz attempt on making a pizza over cooked under cooked raw etc everything was done to perfection !! I must say that if im getting blown away from pizza i should also try 800?
First experience trying this place was not so good the pizza was very doughy and I also asked for well done and got regular. No flavor whatsoever.

Always great service and food is great. 
Always able to order ahead and get fresh food at lunch time, working in the call center behind the building.
